CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Phone Screen stage positioned above or below the HR Interview stage?
SRP.A: The Phone Screen stage is positioned {above} the HR Interview stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {exponential} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage HR Interview?
VE.A: The value of stage HR Interview is {68%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Technical Interview?
VE.A: The value of stage Technical Interview is {42%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Phone Screen, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Offer Accepted, with a value of {20%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Technical Interview to stage Offer Extended?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Technical Interview to stage Offer Extended is {18%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 33%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Phone Screen} stage has {100%}, the {HR Interview} stage has {68%}, the {Technical Interview} stage has {42%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 22%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 22% and 84%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {HR Interview} stage has {68%}, the {Technical Interview} stage has {42%}, the {Offer Extended} stage has {24%}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Technical Interview to Offer Extended, or from stage HR Interview to Technical Interview?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {HR Interview} to {Technical Interview} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Phone Screen to HR Interview, or from stage HR Interview to Technical Interview?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Phone Screen} to {HR Interview} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Offer Extended to Offer Accepted, from stage HR Interview to Technical Interview, or from stage Technical Interview to Offer Extended?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {HR Interview} to stage {Technical Interview} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Phone Screen} and {HR Interview} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Offer Extended} and {Offer Accepted} stages.
